All Is Well bracelet

I would deem this as the perfect women bracelet as the gemstones used harness the female energies in the best way. We are emotional & magical creatures and we should embrace it! Madagascar Rose Quartz promotes feelings of love, gentleness, trust and hope. Unakite helps in easing any deep-seated emotions in a slow and gentle way. It can also aid in metabolism and blood circulation too. As Unakite is a solar plexus chakra stone, it can give relief and support to our hormonal health.

On top of all the goodness and benefits, All Is Well bracelet is a beautiful piece of jewelry that is easy to wear and match with your outfits or styleğŸ’šğŸ’—ğŸ’›

When we first started living in Saudi Arabia, my father would share some stories and cultures with us kids, to have a better understanding of the foreign land that we were in. 

One story which I enjoyed is about bedouins. Bedouins are nomadic people of Arabia and said to be â€˜true Arabsâ€™ due to the purity of their society and way of life. They are especially known for keeping and domesticating camels. It was a treat for me to see them time to time when we drove out into the desert. They seem so free and magical, often wearing the most colorful and interesting garments. I was told that bedouins are super hospitable and take hosting very seriously. If one ever appear at a tent of a bedouin, it is said that they will slaughter their finest animal just to serve their guests.

They have inspired me to create these 3 bracelets with gorgeously vivid colors and embodying seriously good intentions. For the story of bedouins have touched my heart, my dreams and reminded me of love. Each time I see a camel, I would automatically be reminded of their story and the special moments I shared with my family as a child in the desert land.

Arabian Bijou. The story continuesâ€¦

Arabian Bijou is a collection which pays homage to my Arabian childhood. My love for Middle Eastern culture has always played a strong influence in my art. My ability to create art was only recognized by my teachers in Saudi Arabia who paid attention to students beyond the academics. When I was studying in Singapore, my parents did acknowledge that I can draw but as Singapore was such an academically driven nation, no one ever seem to pay much thought to the arts. 

It may have been eons ago, but my teachersâ€™ teachings shaped how I viewed things and made me appreciate little beauty in life, no matter how sullen things can look. It also opened my mind that academics, although important, does not define me or anyone. 

My children are now living in a more open-minded Singapore, where we can be recognized for arts, sports etc. For this, Iâ€™m grateful. 

My precious memories from Saudi Arabia is an ongoing love story and I look forward to telling more stories with this collectionâ¤ï¸

ğŸŒ»PocahontasğŸŒ»
A collection inspired by Native American art. Their stories, bravery and love for nature and natural beauty will never cease to amaze.

I have used Black Tourmaline, Moonstone, Red Jasper, Golden Sheen Obsidian, Turquoise and Carnelian gemstones to represent the use of 4 basic colors- red, black, blue and white. These are part of the elementary colors of human vision and basic color groups. As from these primary colors, a huge wide range of other colors can emerge. 

This is a collection which explores and celebrates the notion of appreciating â€˜the simpler thingsâ€™ in life. Reminding us to return to our core and focus on ourselves. Once we have settled the basics, we can grow into so much more.

A collection inspired by Native American art. Their stories, bravery and love for nature and natural beauty will never cease to amaze.

I have used Black Tourmaline, Moonstone, Red Jasper, Golden Sheen Obsidian, Turquoise and Carnelian gemstones to represent the use of 4 basic colors- red, black, blue and white. These are part of the elementary colors of human vision and basic color groups. As from these primary colors, a huge wide range of other colors can emerge. 

This is a collection which explores and celebrates the notion of appreciating â€˜the simpler thingsâ€™ in life. Reminding us to return to our core and focus on ourselves. Once we have settled the basics, we can grow into so much more.

NEW to Diadem Series

The Diadem Series is inspired by my love for crowns and diadems. There is just something fascinatingly liberating about adorning a crown since I was a little girl.

As per history, crowns and diadems are only worn by exceptional people such as rulers, kings and different forms of royalty. 

The crown traditionally represents triumph, victory, power, honor & glory. Such wonderful and positive meanings which I wish for you to have in your life.

As you adorn our beautiful and exquisite diadem bracelets, I hope you will feel nothing less than royalty and always experience many glories in your life. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

Ametrine Pendant/Necklace

Ametrine is truly an enigmatic crystal as it is a combination of Amethyst & Citrine. For it to become Ametrine, it starts off as a Amethyst crystal which undergoes some immense heat. When the heat only affects a part of the Amethyst crystal, that part turns into yellow Citrine! Since not the entire Amethyst is heated to Citrine, the crystal becomes Ametrine, a delightful amalgam of 2 very special crystals. 

This process requires a phenomenon and specific natural conditions and thus, this makes natural Ametrine gemstones highly desirable and rare.

Iâ€™ve been going through some major self-realization recently and Januaryâ€™s heavy & constant downpours felt like therapy.

Instead of me crying and venting out my frustrations physically, the daily deluge did it for me and represented how I felt.

Each time the downpour ended, I felt cleansed and a little stronger to move forward to the next day.

I drive a lot daily. So what I saw was rain, water and various twinkling colors of lights which inspired this collection greatly. This collection is like my cleanse. My will to stay strong, focus on the necessary, cherish important moments, so I can continue to move on bravely and embrace my life journey.

The main gemstones I have decided to use in this collection Lights & Deluge, focuses on attracting brightness, optimism, decisiveness & protection.

Citrine, Hematite & Pyrite encompass the above wonderful traits & more.

This is one of my most personal collections yet. It forced me to dive into my inner realm and made me look at what I have tried to hide and run away from, for so long.

I find much comfort knowing and understanding- the difficult to talk about, the difficult to feel & the difficult of losing something in order to gain whatâ€™s truly important... myself.

I hope that this collection speaks to you and the jewelry will also represent your feelings to be determined, unwavering & unfraid to let go in order to find yourself... to allow yourself to feel happy. 

Iâ€™m not simply selling jewelry.
What I give to you, is Art.

Art that gives you(& me) courage & willpower, knowing that what you(& me) face now will only last some moments in your(my) life.

And when we have moved through a challenging stage of our life with our CCJ jewelry, we know that we have made it through... and can rejoice together.

Let CCJ jewelry be a reminder of your strength.

The Diadem Series is inspired by my love for crowns and diadems. There is just something fascinatingly liberating about adorning a crown since I was a little girl.

As per history, crowns and diadems are only worn by exceptional people such as rulers, kings and different forms of royalty. 

The crown traditionally represents triumph, victory, power, honor & glory. Such wonderful and positive meanings which I wish for you to have in your life.

As you adorn our beautiful and exquisite diadem bracelets, I hope you will feel nothing less than royalty and always experience many glories in your life.

The Crown Supreme Series is inspired by my love for crowns and diadems. There is just something fascinatingly liberating about adorning a crown since I was a little girl.

As per history, crowns and diadems are only worn by exceptional people such as rulers, kings and different forms of royalty. 

The crown traditionally represents triumph, victory, power, honor & glory. Such wonderful and positive meanings which I wish for you to have in your life.

As you adorn our beautiful and exquisite diadem bracelets, I hope you will feel nothing less than royalty and always experience many glories in your life.

Bloodstone Bookmark/ Letter Opener

This stone has so much history. 

A distinctive feature of Bloodstone is its tiny specks of red spots. An old story was told about how those red spots got there. 

They were said to be the blood of Christ. When Christ was crucified, his sacred blood flowed to the ground and became Bloodstones. And due to this belief, Bloodstone has the reputation of being a health stone. 

Excellent to have at all times to promote good health. Suitable for even for pets!

The natural crystalline structure seen on our distinctive Meteorite gems are known as â€˜Widmanstatten Patternsâ€™. Such features are unique only to this specific Meteorite type.

The square is much more than just a 4 sided figure. The symbolism behind this familiar shape is meant to provide us a sense of grounding, stability and equilibrium. Being human beings, we require order, direction and a sense of belonging to live and survive.

Spiritually, the square is symbolic of foundation, just like most normal houses, they are plotted on squares. This shape is suggested to offer reassurance of protection and center.

In Numerology, the number 4 (squares always have 4 sides) carries the energy being loyal and intelligent.

Thus, Shu wanted to incorporate the symbolic square in her latest jewelry design. CCJ is born from wanting to make crystal healing fashionable so the combination of the square setting and its round gemstone is a harmonious marriage of aesthetics and spirit.

Here at CCJ, our goal is not only to offer the most beautiful and stylish jewelry, but also create meaningful jewelry to aid in your healing journeyâ¤ï¸

The CCJ Trinity has 3 main anchoring stones. The CCJ Pentagon has 5 main anchoring stones- the transition from 3 to 5 is again, representative of growth.
The CCJ Pentagon setting is the perfect jewelry for #ccjgirls who wish to grow mentally and spiritually with time. Like our hands with 5 indispensable fingers, the 5 anchoring gemstones of the Pentagon are here to support you, to hold you as you brave this journey called Life.

www.covetcrystals.com

The Story Of Pentagon
(Part 2)

Came early June 2020, the CCJ Pentagon setting was finally born. This design with a graduation of little to larger gemstones was a symbol of growth. And a gradual growth at that, with each larger gemstone signifying a step-by-step growth.
Similar to its predecessor (CCJ Trinity setting), the Pentagon CCJ setting also allow the gemstones to sit nicely on the wrist and flaunt the gemstones beautifully from all angles with any wrist or hand movements.

The Story of Pentagon
(Part 1)

I wanted to create another design which harmonized as well as the CCJ Trinity setting. Since mid-2019, I had set my mind to this task and started some research and experimentation with varying designs. I was very thankful and very much inspired by CCJâ€™s amazing growth in 2019. 

This growth, I give credit and gratitude to our dear #ccjgirls. We wish to thank so many of you whom told your family and friends about us. 

The new design was finalized during the quieter months of 2020, during the Singapore Lockdown period when movement for CCJ slowed down and I had the opportunity to focus more on research & development.

â€˜A woman needs ropes and ropes of Pearlsâ€™

-Coco Chanel

Pearls have been admired for their beauty for centuries. Considered as the worldâ€™s oldest gems, they have been adorned and loved as jewelry by many cultures. The Chinese discovered this delicate gem over 4000 years ago while searching the ocean for food.

During the first century BC, Pearls were so precious and dear that they were only allowed to be worn by the ruling class in Rome empire. Tributes of Pearls were commonly presented between royalties of different countries to establish cordial relationships in the ancient world.

With such a venerable and long history, there are many interesting stories about Pearls. Apparently, Cleopatra served wine with crushed pearls at her parties to prove to the Romans that her dinners were the most decadent. Whilst during the Dark Ages, knights kept Pearls close to them to keep safe on the battlefield. 

For us here at CCJ, we love wearing Pearls as we believe that they have the magical ability to give mental hugs. Harnessing very clean and pure energy, Pearls tend to attract much positivity and luck for their wearers. 

Exquisite and healing jewelry? Yes please!

Apparently, Cleopatra served wine with crushed pearls at her parties to prove to the Romans that her dinners were the most decadent. Whilst during the Dark Ages, knights kept Pearls close to them to keep safe on the battlefield. 

For us here at CCJ, we love wearing Pearls as we believe that they have the magical ability to give mental hugs. Harnessing very clean and pure energy, Pearls tend to attract much positivity and luck for their wearers. 

Exquisite and healing jewelry? Yes please!

CCJ Classics

The iconic Trinity-3 stones setting took 8 months to develop and finalize into what made CCJ jewelry distinctive right from the start.

For designing, one must come up with a theme or some fundaments to base on.

I might have been new to jewelry making then,but not to accessorizing. My years of styling myself, friends and love for fashion had given me a very clear idea on what my Art should achieve.

Looking beautiful was a no brainer. Looking expensive was a bonus. 
Looking exquisite on the wrist was the most important. 

There must be balance.However the hand is moved,the bracelet should flatter the wrist and excite the eyes.

After the months of deliberation and trials, I concluded that the â€˜tripod formâ€™ was the ideal.

The 3 stones anchor the wrist beautifully as the hand is turned left, right or around,one can see the full design and admire the gems easily.

Plus,this form made it more simple for me to adjust the sizing of the bracelets to fit small to plus-size wrists,without compromising any design.

Being a Fine Arts trained artist, I am fascinated with shapes.There was once,I read that the tripod form is the strongest form.Able to withstand lateral movements,standing firm without a sweat. 

This idea appealed to my romantic side tremendously as I was creating CCJ for the sole purpose of making crystal healing fashionable.The idea of being strong,not succumbing to outside forces was what I wanted to achieve so badly.Suffering from depression is no fun.

There after,I had to name this design. Obviously naming it the Tripod setting sounded erm...and thus the name Trinity was used instead to represent this CCJ iconic design.

It has taken me almost 3 years to tell this little story and it feels good. I was initially afraid to share it as I did not know how.Ironically,it has taken numerous flattering copycats and time to make me realize that it is okay to tell a story straight as it is.

There are more to completing the look but details will be spared for now.

I always seek to improve and create new designs,as one have observed from recent collections, but the Trinity setting shall always be my baby as it was the firstâ¤ï¸

I wasnâ€™t kidding when I said these 2 are my present favourites.

Canâ€™t go anywhere without them!

This is one of my favorite sky poems by Emily Dickinson. 
The Brain- is wider than the Sky-

For- put them side by side-

The one the other will contain 
With ease- and You- beside

The Brain is deeper than the sea-

For- hold them- Blue to Blue-

The one the other will absorb-

As Sponges- Buckets- do- 
The Brain is just the weight of God

For- Heft them- Pound for Pound- 
And they will differ- if they do-

As Syllable from Sound-

Horizon Sky.

This collection depicts some of my favorite images of the sky.

To me, the sky has so many representations.

Whenever I look up to the sky, so many feelings flood my mind. I feel awed, humbled and inspired all at the same time. I am reminded how small I am but in spite of size, I have the ability to contribute to society or be a parasite. We all do.

We all share one sky. On one planet. At the end of the day, our choices make us who we are. And the sky is a constant reminder of beginning and end- day & night.

So happy to present our Lucky Nyonya Collection.

This collection features my first gemstone love- Jade.

I have always loved Jade due to its desirable green color and its symbol of purity and protection. 
The Chinese people have valued Jade for centuries. Using this precious stone for tools, ornaments and especially jewelry. They love Jade not only for its aesthetic appearance but also for what it represents.

It is said by famed Chinese philosopher Confucius that Jade represents 11 virtues- intelligence, music, loyalty, earth, morality, heaven, credibility, propriety, truth, justice and benevolence. 
The Peranakan culture also inspired the art behind this Jade collection. To me, the Jade gem is a graceful, virtuous and exquisite lady who loves flowers and opens the door of prosperity to her family.

The Yellow Tridacna gemstones are sourced from the deep seas off Hainan Islands and are only found there.
Only old and deceased Tridacna Gigas Shells were permitted to be harvested for their beauty in jewelry. 
Unfortunately, as it was quite impossible to ensure that such ethnics are practised, the Chinese Government has banned any future harvests. And thus, what you see, are the last batches of the Tridacnas gemstones.

Tridacnas came in a variety of colors and the rarest was known to be the Yellow Tridacna, distinctive by its golden line which only a small quantity of clams possessed. Each clam had been carefully opened, inspected and then carefully carved to allow us to enjoy its natural beauty and benefit from its healing energies.

We see this collection as heirloom material and we hope you will take pleasure from it.

Visit www.covetcrystals.com for more information ğŸ’›ğŸ’›ğŸ’›

Tanzanite & Garnet SHW Earrings

Tanzanite is one of the rarest crystals in the world-found only on Mount Kilimanjaro, Tanzania.

It is said that these precious crystals were created by lightning. Around 1930s, there was a massive thunderstorm and lightning struck the lands causing a massive fire. People fled and when they returned, they found these sparkling Indigo gems.

Tanzanite is becoming rarer and more valuable, as supply is expected to dry up in appx 12 years.

Tanzanite is becoming rarer and more valuable, as supply is expected to dry up in appx 12 years.

Throat & Third Eye

Painting Series

I am so proud to exhibit this new collection, inspired by my wonderful childhood memories of travelling China with my family.

The place in specific, was Yunnan. I was spellbinded by the enchanting beauty of nature in her supreme glory.

By the River, By the Flowers & By the Mountain are my interpretations to allow you to feel and experience the delightful sights and healing benefits with our precious crystals and gemstones.

These gemstones are the best of their categories. All natural, untreated and thus, providing one with the best energies that authentic healing stones can give.

Shuâ€™s usual design style for CCJ has always been elaborate & intricate.

But this very special collection was created based on her recent trip to Perth, her happy place.

Through this collection, she expresses her purest intentions. Her vision is to empower other women like herself, to be the best they can be, moving on this journey towards better mental health.

The Blue Jade Ammonite collection is stripped bare and truly simple in a bid to exhibit what CCJ is really about.

Over the thousands of years as Man developed, the shape of massage and facial stones evolved into one of todayâ€™s Gua Sha.

The foundational practice of Gua Sha involves slow, steady strokes that, possibly immediately or over time, can create the appearance of lift, tone, clarity, and brightness in the face. Some have called Facial Gua Sha, a natural alternative to injectables like Botox.

The strokes of the Gua Sha can infuse our tissues with blood and chi (or â€œqiâ€), the Traditional Chinese Medicine word for energy. This can aid in blood circulation to enhance complexion and health.

Lucky Ammonite Necklace

The Ammonite is considered a very lucky symbol in both the Western and Chinese cultures.

The Western culture believes the Ammonite has the ability to provide continual cleansing of positive energies due to its spiral feature. Negative energies are sucked in from the opening of the Ammonite, filtered and cleansed through each spiral, finally releasing positive energies at the middle.

The Chinese culture believes that the Ammonite attracts and sucks in luck and wealth. And due to its spiral feature, the luck and wealth are held within the Ammonite, thus bringing good fortune and abundance to the wearer.

Both cultures have different conceptions but the overall beliefs are the same- the Ammonite is a lucky gemstone to possess.

Cinnabar is another reason why we believe in crystal healing. 
If crystals can harm, then definitely it can also do the opposite, which is to heal. 
The puffer fish is a delicacy which requires decades of training to prepare and nourish the body. But if not prepared properly, it can poison and hurt the body instead. 
This example relates very well to the application of crystals.

Cinnabar is actually one of the most poisonous crystals in the world. Despite this, it has proven itself to be an incredibly useful crystal, worn not only for its beauty but also as rouge in the past. 
The awareness of its high mercury levels has been known since its initial discovery and thus, much studies have gone into preparing it, to ensure toxins are not exposed during use.
For jewelry, it is actually melted then molded into beads or other required shapes so it becomes safe to wearğŸ˜˜

Presenting the magical and mysterious Phantom Quartz.

This crystal looks like no other as it possesses a rare and unique formation within. The patterns inside the crystals are created from interruptions during their growth. Such blockages create a diversity of mineral deposits which form the distinctive Phantom shapes, hence its name.

Not only is Phantom Quartz beautiful and mesmerizing to look at, it is hailed as one of the most powerful healing crystals. 
Phantom Quartz harnesses powerful manifestion energy which attracts remarkably strong, positive energies. 
It is so beneficial that it is often used in assisting people who need to get over past traumas, to allow them to learn and grow from negative experiences.

I remember first seeing the Larimar online. I could not stop thinking about it so I went to hunt for it.
During then, I had just started on crystal healing so I was highly unfamiliar with the pricing of premium stones.
I got $100 ready thinking I'm all set to purchase and add it to my very tiny collection of anti-depression stones. 
So when I was told it was double the price for the size I wanted, I was shocked, horrified and thought because I was new, I was an attempt for con.
I didn't buy anything that day as I walked out in a huff, grumbling that I'm not a fool.
Thinking back, indeed I was a fool as I started really looking around and discovered that Larimar is a premium stone, only found in Dominican Republic, of volcanic origin and its blue has no rival.
Sheepishly I went back to the original shop to purchase my first Larimar piece and since then, my Larimar has captured the attention and orders of many.
*blessed

The design is created around the Blue Amber.
Blue?? Where got blue? The closest blue stone there... isn't that the Blue Lace Agate?

Heheh yes! That is the Blue Lace Agate. Blue Amber is actually the yellow stone. Technically it isn't a crystal due to its molecular structure and formation but fossilized resin from trees! (I call it Earth's saliva lol). This special gemstone is found Dominican Republic (yes, home of our beloved Larimars). So why is it named blue again?
It actually turns bluish when uv is shone on it. If you look closely at the photos, you can see tinges of blue.

Two months back, I was at the suppliers'. I was shown some Phantom Amethyst as a bunch of them were recently discovered and mined. I saw the 8-10mm sizes( the usual sizes in CCJ) and was like 'nay'.
But luckily, I saw a big one(14mm) winking at me and I was like 'waittttt, don't keep yet!!' We quickly poured out the big bag of stones and tada!, these beautiful big beauties are part of my creationsğŸ˜Š
Because they are much larger, you can actually see another crystal grown within the Amethyst(thus its name of Phantom Quartz).
Super beautiful.

Aiya, I seriously need to invest in a better camera ğŸ˜…
The darker stones are Petrified Wood. If you see them in person, they are actually a deep green with bits of woody brown.
Commonly, Petrified Wood is just... brown. Kinda like latte? I've never worked with those as I felt they weren't aesthetically pleasing enough as jewelry ğŸ™ƒ

Look closely...
Can you spot which is the elusive greenish Petrified Wood?ğŸŒ²
